1.25.23  1:34 pm   Can you help me come up with a more modern equivalent to the "you reap what you sow" expression? Not many people reap and sow these days, except maybe farmers and even farmers probably have machines that do that now.

      you get what you give

      no. just myself, and was also chasing myself at the same time

      first you must figure out where you live

1.25.23  3:14 am   what are your thoughts on tax evasion?

1.25.23  2:58 am   I accidentally came up with a super cool melody with awesome chords... but no lyrics. What do you recommend I do here? I worry that anything I come up with will feel forced

      it's there. if the melody and chords really are super cool, then there is a lyricized version that does work. there are a few tricks to help hone in on it. gather the tiny details that you think you know, or almost know. For example: maybe you know a certain word works really well for part of it, for example let's say the word 'banana' just sounds perfect for the last part of it. Or, maybe you know banana sounds great for that part but you doubt it should be about bananas. Add that factoid to your list of factoids, regardless. write down that you love the word banana at the end but you're not sure if it could work. See if you can hone in on any other things you know, about other tiny parts of it. What can you rule out? what can you rule in? Here's another exercise: just start coming up with as many phoenecically functional things as possible that fit, without regard for what you want it to mean. This will help you notice things: for example you might notice that 80% of the results are phrased as a question. You may notice that these 2 little notes there are always either "in the" or "and it". You may notice that certain phrases keep fitting a certain part, over and over. Now, on the other side of the coin, here's a totally different exercise to try: paraphrase the whole feeling of it, without the melody. so just write down, in as many words as you like, what you think the melody is saying, without worrying about how many words or syllables you use. anything you can grasp onto. maybe you think it has a feeling of freshness. maybe you think it has a feeling of 'morning'. maybe you think it has a feeling of sorrow. maybe you think it has a feeling of good news. write down as much as you can about what you think the melody feels like. Then, maybe certain key words will pop out at you that possibly DO fit. And most importantly, regardless of whether any of this works, going through all this makes it much more likely that the answer will actually just fall on your head later when you're not even thinking about it

1.25.23  2:14 am   What is the difference between objects and art?

      no difference. they are the same thing

1.24.23  11:09 pm   hi bill!  would you ever fuck a donut?

      donuts are self fucking

1.24.23  11:00 pm   whats a good ingredient to add to kraft mac n cheese

      a box, to put it in

1.24.23  10:41 pm   can you teach me french

      no. you should let France teach you french

1.24.23  10:16 pm   Walt whitman once said "I contain multitudes".

     seems out of context, but i'll go along with it for now

     Do you ever get lost in your own multitudes?

     yes

     If you have them. Shrimp

1.24.23  8:37 pm   Do you think it's funny that, because "sports" sounds similar to "fourth" and the interval from E to A is a fourth, you can say "EA Fourth" like the game intro and be correct?

      that reminds me of plugging in your guitar with a power cord and playing a power chord

1.24.23  7:49 pm   about how many nights do you remain awake through per year?

      if night is defined by the entire time between any given sunset and the following sunrise, i'd say maybe 20 to 30, with most of those probably being around june, simply due to the shorter timespan of the night period. and in most cases i would have gotten a full length sleep preceding and following, which would be largely during daylight in that case

1.24.23  7:33 pm   if you where to hypothetically make an album to compile your songs from say 2018 to now what order do you think they would be in?

      chronologically in order of release date

1.24.23  7:25 pm   Do you love Satan or have ever associated with members of a Satanic organization?

     never heard of it

     If applicable, how would you describe the nature of your relationship to Satan and its affiliates and subsidiaries?

     not applicable

     If applicable, when did this relationship begin, and if applicable, when did it end?

     not applicable

     If applicable, describe your first encounter with Satan to the fullest extent of your memory. Include any details pertaining to transactions and anomalies.

     not applicable

     Any words that you spoke or heard must be quoted verbatim. If applicable, describe your subsequent encounters with Satan.

     not applicable

     If applicable, describe any benefit and any harm that has come to you as a result of your association with Satan.

     not applicable

     Thank you for your time.

     you're welcome

     Godspeed.

      already been mixed. lamp and dog are the same

      the middle one

      bland

1.24.23  3:41 pm   How would you name an indie boyband in 2023?

      same as naming anything. gather everything you know about them, bundle it all together in your mind, and see if lightning strikes. for example, the one you mentioned, i would call it 'indie boyband in 2023'

1.24.23  3:37 pm   what would you do if someone offered you a helping hand

      try to help them also

1.24.23  11:12 am   do you usually give advice on life stuff like keeping good habits and such, or is it something avoidable? personally I find it weird when people ask me for these things mostly cuz I have no idea if or how I do it. 

      you could say 'hmm, let me think' and just keep thinking about it

1.24.23  11:10 am   what is the chord progression you used for "centralparkwestwtf"?

happy tuesday bill

      that should be straight out of the real book. did the melody last, and didn't know the song before i did it. so the chords you're hearing is literally me reading chord symbols off the chart

      life

     it usually pays, if it's serious. if you can't get one of those yet, you can always practice at an unpaid one

1.23.23  5:09 pm   what's the best adjective to describe a very surprising and baffling situation besides "surprising" and "baffling"

      there's no exact best because the best one is often the freshest, therefore it changes. but my middle name is 'Mr. Thesaurus' so i'll try to give you some options here:
      shocking
      riveting
      enthralling
      earth shattering
      mind exploding
      bonkers
      bonquers
      hilarious
      out of left field
      out of right field
      directly across home plate
      right in the pocket

1.23.23  3:36 pm   do you like watching movies in theaters?

     it's pretty cool but i haven't done it in a while

     or would you rather watch them from the comfort of your home?

     home is way more convenient. but if there is a new movie sometimes i try to find a fairly unpopular theater and go there on week 3 on monday at 11am and there's literally no one else in the entire theatre. that feels pretty special
